name: Comfort Inn & Suites North Conway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second visit to this hotel. It is located centrally on the main White Mountain highway in North Conway. Adjacent to the hotel is the Pirate Cove Mini golf course which is popular with fmailies with young children. the hotel has an indoor pool only however the rooms are suites with a large sitting area, sink, microwave, fridge and coffee maker. We had a kingsize bed on the main floor which was handy and the room was clean and comfortable. The desk staff are courteous, friendly and eager to assist in recommending restaurants and directions. although it was a few years since our last visit the lady on the desk recognized our name and greeted us with friendly conversation. On check in, they gave us each a smalll bottle of water and htey had fresh cookies on the reception desk for guests. Great breakfast, with coffee, juice, eggs, sausage, waffles, bagels, danishs, toast, english muffins, cereal, oatmeal and fresh fruit. We were able to freeze our ice packs and keep cold bottled water. Overall a great place to stay with welcoming staff.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

reviews.text: Rooms and hotel were clean. Breakfast was great(big variety and complimentary). Within walking distance the outlets(approx 1 mile) and the staff was very welcoming and friendly.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: Clean up to date accommodations. Nice location near to attractions, but not too close. Quiet well kept property. Superb management and staff. Price for rooms well worth the cost versus basic local motels. Complimentary breakfast has a little bit for everyone. Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Service!

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights- Thurs, Friday, and Sunday. Booked it with "Helen" on the phone a few weeks in advance and she was at the desk when we checked in. She wasn't able to get me the king suite that I wanted but we had a room with 2 double beds, a mini-fridge, and a microwave. I put our icepacks from our small cooler into the mini-fridge freezer and used the fridge for leftovers, milk, and beverages. We got 3 small waters when we checked in and there were cookies at the front desk every night too (oatmeal raisin). Our room had a desk and a small dining table and 3 chairs. I would have liked a 2nd night stand on the side near the windows but oh well. Housekeeping did a fine job of cleaning up after us and arranging my daughter's stuffed animals every day. We also tried to utilize the recycling a little bit that was in the hallway too. We were in room 101 so we did not need the elevator. It did look like the elevator was rather was small and the area outside the elevator got very crowded in the mornings when people were having breakfast and checking out etc.
reviews.title: I'm on the fence on this one. Has it's pros and cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is taking me some time to write this review. This is a small hotel compared to the other chains. It has wi-fi, and indoor pool, and a breakfast. All things I want in a hotel. However, the wi-fi was a little slow at night. There were 2 of us using it in our room and it was not speedy. The pool was so small that with just 3 kids it feels full, and many times I saw 6 or 7 kids in it (not surprising) and skipped it with my daughter. We did the mini-golf instead. The one time we did use the pool it was FREEZING!! The kids were okay but all the adults were frozen.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed here for a long weekend at the end of the summer... Rooms were clean, staff friendly, continental breakfast just right and location convenient! If u are looking for a spacious room that is clean, this is the spot!
reviews.title: Stayed here for a long weekend at the end...

reviews.text: Hotel is well located in the center of the area. Good breakfast included with ample supply of breakfast foods. Hotel is clean and well maintained. Room are large enough with windows that open to allow fresh air rather than air conditioning. Only negative are the pillows. While there are a number of them, they are very small, too soft and can't take the place of a decent pillow. Need to have new pillows. Otherwise, good hotel.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really the cleanest, nicest, friendliest Comfort Inn I have ever stayed in. Would come back in a flash. Conveniently located, fun.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was excited by the excellent reviews of this place, and was not disappointed at all. The rooms are good-sized and clean, the staff was very friendly and accommodating, the breakfast was good. The only thing I could complain about would be the small bathrooms - the door barely has room to swing open past the toilet. But really, that's just nitpicking. You won't be disappointed by this place, it absolutely lives up to it's rating.
reviews.title: Everything Meets or Exceeds Expectations

reviews.text: stayed here August of 2009. It was very clean and comfortable. Beds were soft. Good lighting in bathroom, Breakfast included in price which is a big plus.Located on the main strip in North Conway. You could walk to restaurants. Close to many hikes and Mt. Washington.I would stay here again .
reviews.title: clean and comfortable

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Comfort Inn in North Conway at least six times (once a summer) while visiting our kids at the summer camp that they attend nearby. One year the Comfort Inn was sold out, and we stayed a similar style hotel in North Conway (also highly rated on Tripadvisor), so I have some basis for comparison in the North Conway market.
reviews.title: A tremendously well-run and reliable hotel

reviews.text: Each year I have said that I should write a review because it is obvious that the management and staff of this hotel seem to care so much that the place is well run, clean, and that their guests have the best possible experience. You leave feeling that these people really deserve to do well and to be complimented for it. We typically stay at very high-end properties when we travel (there are none in North Conway), and it is rare even at such places to find the people uniformly trying so hard to provide a great guest experience. No, this is not the Four Seasons in Nevis. It does not have a gigantic pool and 24-hour room service (nor does it cost anything like a Four Seasons resort does). But for a place to stay in North Conway that you can count on to be the exceptionally good at what it is -- a moderately priced chain hotel -- you can't go wrong at the Comfort Inn.
reviews.title: The kids loved it!

reviews.text: Our room was very spacious and very clean. My kids loved the space and the extra bed, and the kitchen made our trip smooth. Sudden rain forced us to stay in the hotel for half a day, and the kids actually had a lot of fun in the swimming pool and playing in the room. Unfortunately, it seems that prices are going up, so it's likely that we'd find it difficult to come back.
reviews.title: great size rooms VERY small pool.

reviews.text: We love this hotel and it works great for out family with many small children. The only problem is the VERY small pool. It is not big enough for more than a couple families to enjoy. We saw families come down to swim only to leave before ever getting in the pool because it was already full. Everything else was great!
reviews.title: Very Very CLEAN!

reviews.text: I visited this hotel with my family for 2 nights, for a Santa's Village and Story Land getaway. The hotel was extremely clean! I have stayed at more expensive hotels in he area in the past and they were not even close to this clean. The free breakfast was delicious, there is something for everybody. There were make your own Belgian waffles, eggs, sausage, French toast sticks, bagels, fresh fruit, yogurt, and lots of other choices. The coffee was delicious as well!! For our family of four, we saved at least $60 on not having to pay for breakfast somewhere else. The staff at the front desk were all extra friendly and went out of their way to make sure we were satisfied with our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you everyone at the Comfort Inn and Suites! We will be returning in the future!
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: Although on the main drag for N. Conway, it was quiet and well situated to the outlets and downtown. We used AAA discount for a reasonable rate...we got a 1 king bed room suite for a last minute overnight trip. Very large suite compared to other comfort inns and hotel chains. It was clean and well maintained. Our son stayed in his travel crib in livingroom with plenty of room for his stuff. Micro fridge and microwave were useful too with table for 4....I'd recommend this hotel for a week long hotel stay for a family. Also our room was right next to vending, elevator and ice machine and we never heard any noise or we slept right through it. Only negative was the bed was awful but for 1 night it was fine.
reviews.title: Good family hotel option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for only 1 night, but we were impressed! My main concern in any hotel is cleanliness, and this hotel was immaculate. Clean room, clean bathroom. Common areas ... clean, clean, clean!!! The staff was friendly and helpful. We always try to stay at Comfort Inn's when travelling, and we were certainly not disappointed by this hotel. We also enjoyed the complimentary breakfast .... always a welcome amenity.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel!

reviews.text: Stopped at this hotel en route from Ontario to New Brunswick (via USA). The staff were very professional, the hotel was clean, well located and comfortable for our families needs. The price was reasonable for peak summer season. We all got homemade chocolate chip cookies at check-in, yum and we were offered bottles of cold water. We would definitely stay here again if I had the chance. Really liked the room configuration as the kids, 5 yrs on the pull-out couch and 2 yrs in the crib, were slightly separated from our main living area and we were able to quietly watch tv after they fell asleep.
reviews.title: Perfect for families - Great Service - Great Location

reviews.text: The only minor complaint, and it is somewhat trivial, is that the tempurature of the pool was a little bit too cool for our little one. She was shivering within the first 5 minutes. The pool area was sauna steamy but the water was not as warm as we might have hoped.
reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service & Hotel

reviews.text: It was getting late and we were having difficulty finding a hotel with vacancy and/or something not ridiculously expensive. We came upon the Comfort Inn and were pleased they had a room with a King size bed and a queen size pull out sofa for under $200 (this is a prime summer attraction area). Upon entering our room it smelled horribly of smoke (this is supposed to be an all non-smoking hotel - gotta love those smokers who just can't control themselves!). Anyway, we immediately went back down to the front desk and the woman was extremely apologetic. I emphasized it was not her fault. She could not find us another room at that same price but instead upgraded us to a 2 room suite for the same price as the other room! The room we had was fantastic and very spacious (the king sized bed was in a separate room with a large closet and the pull-out sofa was in the living room area which was attached to a small kitchenette with a table, fridge, etc.). It was very clean and comfortable. The cups in the bathroom were all individually bagged and they had the usual toiletries on the counter. The beds were VERY comfortable and filled with lots of pillows. The bedding for the pull-out sofa was bagged and placed in a closet and when we took the sheets and blanket out they smelled clean and fresh! The room also came with a complimentary buffet hot breakfast the next morning for the entire family - complete with eggs, sausage, pancakes, waffles, bagels, toast, pastries, cereal (hot and cold), etc. Any staff members we encountered were extremely nice and polite. I wish we had more time to enjoy the hotel! I would definitely stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone.
reviews.title: Nice, friendly staff - Good amenities for families

reviews.text: We arrived at the Comfort Inn last week for our annual NH trip. The moment we walked in, we knew our stay would be pleasant. The staff was very welcoming and had some great recommendations for us. Our room was very clean and comfrotable...and spacious. We chose a room with 2 double beds for my husband, my 3 yr old daughter and me. Rooms in other hotels seem to be very cramped. This one was a great size and had a refrigerator and microwave in the room. Accomdations were updated and not dated like others we have stayed in. They have an indoor pool. it may not be the largest but the kids had a blast. Next door is the Pirate's Cove miniature golf and we had so much fun there. Our trip revolved around our visit to Storyland and Santa's Village so we were gone during the day and when we returned the Comfort Inn felt like coming home. The continental breakfast was terrific. It composed of cereals, toast, yogurt, fruit, pastry and waffles. It was packed every morning. Let me just point out that we were there during the week and other hotels we drove by listed Vacancies but the Comfort inn had No Vacancy and I know why now. We stayed somewhere else last year and were very disapponted with that location's old, musty smell... I will never choose another Hotel when vacationing in NH .... This is the BEST Hotel and Service we received in a while. Thank you!
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL ...WONDERFUL STAFF!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived here on the morning after our horrible stay in Laconia (see previous review) and were so happy and surprised at this hotel!! The front staff is the best. We were about 4 hours early for check in but our room was ready and we could go right up..no extra charge. The room was a king mini-suite and was beautiful...spotlessly clean! The bed was one of the most comfortable we have ever slept on. We did not go to the continental breakfast while there but it looked wonderful and I heard people complimenting it. The front staff asked us every day if there was anything they could do, did we need any help with anything....a top notch crew!!! They also have a really neat 36 hole miniature golf course right on the grounds....lots of fun. They are close to all the attractions in North Conway. The rates are reasonable for the rooms and service you receive. We go to this area every year for our anniversary and this will be where we will stay from now on. It is also very kid friendly. There were a lot of families with young children there but due to the hotels 10PM curfew for young children, it was very quiet...noise was never a problem.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels!

reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: Great Bed & room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy check in, good price because no 2 day requirement like the other local hotels. Nice room was the perfect tempurture when we walked in. (when was the last time you didn't have to turn it up or down?) Loved the bed I usually don't sleep well the first night at any hotel, if you are trying to go green this is the place to stay. Breakfast was pretty good did have better down in the southern states (sausage & gravy bisquits!) N. conway had a power out the night we stayed but the desk clerk was right there with the flashlight!
reviews.title: Nice place to stay when flying into Fryburg, ME
Nice place to stay
reviews.text: My friend and I were flying my airplane to Fryburg Maine for the 4th of July weekend to check out the mountains and scenery, and needed a place to stay. Found this comfort in just over the ME/NH border which was just a short taxi ride from airport. Hotel was clean and modern, located near many outlet stores. My travel partner and I enjoyed the comfortable bed, soft sheets and cool air conditioning on a hotter than hell summer night! There is a nice chinese restraunt right next door, with decent food. There is also a nightclub next door, too.

We have stayed here several time now, on our annual trek to Storyland. The king rooms (suites) are on the small size for 2 adults and a 7 year old, but are always clean with plenty of extra blankets/pillows/towels. Rooms have mini fridge, microwave and 4 cup coffee maker.
reviews.title: Always a good experience !!!

reviews.text: Check in is always fast and friendly, usually with a free snack or bottle of water. There is a small indoor pool just off the lobby; great for a dip, not so great for laps. The hotel shares property with a VERY COOL 36 hole mini golf course that is open at night. Nice continental breakfast each morning.
reviews.title: Nice, spacious, clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the least costly chain hotel on the "strip"......friendly staff, clean rooms, great restaurants within walking distance. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!
Exactly what we expected!
reviews.text: BIG TIP !!!!! ALWAYS request a room at the front of the hotel. There is a nightclub in a mini-mall behind the hotel, and you get THUMP-THUMP-THUMP everytime the door opens. Kept us awake all night our first stay. Alway get a from facing room, and no more problems !!

We booked a king room online and used our AAA discount. At the last minute, there was some confusion (on our part) over whether we still needed the room. Bill at the front desk was extremely understanding and helpful to us, and we're glad we ended up stayIng.
reviews.title: Love it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The workers at the front desk started the experience by being very friendly. The rooms were impeccable and unexpectedly large. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. The pool was clean with great hours, breakfast was fantastic, the mini-golf was a fun adventure and I would highly recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend--Will exceed expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went skiing in the area for an overnight trip and wanted a reasonably priced hotel. This place was a great find. The room was awesome and the price was right. If you have AAA you can save 10%. It had plenty of amenities like a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker right in the room. Breakfast was also included and was quite tasty. The staff was very helpful and the location was extremely convenient. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to save money and likes a clean and comfortable place to stay.
reviews.title: Great Deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I have stayed and different hotels around the Mt. Washington Valley, but this one has seem to be one the best value we have received for the money. My wife and I found this hotel, because the first one we were looking for was already overbooked, and we needed a place to stay. We ended up at this hotel by recommendation from one of the locals, and it was more than we expected. Very neat and clean room, super comfortable bed, the staff was more that friendly, and the continental breakfast exceeded my expectations. A nice room with a king size bed, amenities such as mini kitchen, and even a pool, for under US$120.00 on a Saturday night, without previous reservations.
reviews.title: The best value in the area!

reviews.text: We do a lot of skiing in the area, and I truly believe this will be our next home away from home in the heart of the white mountains.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay for Storyland trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect place to stay when visiting Storyland or any North Conway attraction. The location is great and the hotel has plenty to offer. The Pirates Cove miniature golf is lots of fun and right on property. The hotel is very clean, breakfast is included and has enough choices to start the morning off right.
reviews.title: Beware the conference room

reviews.text: Free continental breakfast and free wireless internet are a plus. Excellent location - close to many good restaurants and shopping. Also has a nice mini-golf (Pirate's Cove) which is a hit with families. Overall an excellent choice for families.
reviews.title: Nice, clean, and comfortable

reviews.text: The Comfort Inn in North Conway certainly lives up to the "comfort" in its name. This was my first time staying at this inn and I was very impressed with the cleanliness, comfort, and friendliness of the staff. Upon our arrival, which was about 2 hours before check in time, we were allowed to check in and were greeted in a quaint but very clean lobby by a very friendly woman at the desk. Soon we realized that this hotel was smaller than we were used to, although it was three floors, but I can say that my family enjoyed its size very much.
reviews.title: Definitely COMFORTable! Best Rooms in the Valley!

reviews.text: When we arrived at our room, which was on the second floor, we were amazed when we opened the door by the updated, clean room that stood before us. I have to say, never before have I stayed in a room that was so excellent. This room was spacious, and had conveniences such as a couch, coffee maker, microwave, and sink in the room itself, among many other things. I can truly say that if you want the best room in the Valley for the price, this is the place to go! I was also impressed by the fact that although there was a floor above us, you could here a pin drop at night as we slept like babies on the comfortable beds provided.
reviews.title: Stellar - A great value!
Outstanding staff and accommodations
reviews.text: As far as amenities go, I used the exercise area and computer and found both to be above my standards, and although I didn't swim in the indoor pool, it looked very clean and well kept. Among these great qualities, in the summer time, Pirates Cove Mini Golf is just outside the door and the location of the hotel itself, is right in the center of the Valley's shopping district.

The only negatives about this hotel is that in the summer, from what I have seen, fills up of Pirates Cove customers, which may make parking close to the hotel difficult. Also, the bathrooms in the rooms could be a little bit bigger. I mean if you were sitting on the toilet and somebody swung the door open, you'd probably bust your knee!
reviews.title: Best Ski Hotel in North Conway

aka: Comfort Inn & Suites North Conway Hotel North Conway
